intro: Trichilia moschata subsp. matudae, commonly known as the fragrant wood-apple, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, oily wood and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces round, fleshy fruits that enclose numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. The subspecies matudae is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and slightly different morphological features compared to the typical form.
